vision.notes: As members of Trichoptera, Hydroptilidae likely possess functional vision for navigation and mate location, although specific details are unknown. Further research needed on visual acuity and spectral sensitivity.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely important for detecting water currents and substrate vibrations, both in larval and adult stages. This would aid in finding food, avoiding predators, and potentially in pupation site selection.

chemoreception.notes: Important for locating suitable food sources and oviposition sites. Larvae likely use chemoreception to assess water quality and detect algal blooms or detritus. Adults likely use it for mate location.
